ratings.comment: She is very knowledgeable in Horticulture field, but she's a horrible lecturer. She puts A LOT of information on the slides so you can't keep up with it and don't know what part is important. I stopped going to the lecture after the first exam but it didn't make any difference since she puts random stuff on her tests.

Sara talks very fast in lecture and goes through her slides very quickly, which makes it difficult to take notes. Labs often felt like a waste of time, but they were sometimes fun. Her tests covered a lot of content and were relatively hard. However, you were able to use a note card on them, and study guides were provided.
Is very smart and knows a lot about horticulture but goes so fast that you cannot understand her. Doesn't explain things well and the tests are near impossible if you miss any lectures.

Sara was alright. Lectures were boring and seemed like they went on forever. Additionally, she talks fast so it was hard to take complete notes. Labs also seemed pointless at times. One class we spent 1.5 hours commuting to a garden, and only spend 30mins actually there. Tests can also be hard, but overall the class isn't that bad.

Sara is a very entertaining person and was very fun to interact with in lab. But her lectures seemed to drone on most of the time and she moved so quickly through her powerpoints that it was impossible to keep up. Some of the tests were very difficult and didn't seem to match up completely with lecture material, but she does offer extra credit.
She's very easy going and will raise your grade if you normally do well.

Sara is the sweetest hippie you'll meet and she knows a lot about plants, so her lectures are pretty interesting, although be warned-she moves pretty fast. Labs are usually like field trips, like visiting gardens or planting plants, and are basically just graded on attendance. The 1 problem is the tests which are tough, USE YOUR NOTECARD WISELY!

Went in to office hours to ask a question-Sara was not at all helpful and later made a joke in lecture about the question I'd asked. While she didn't mention my name, I found her joke extremely rude and unprofessional. Labs are unorganized and boring, lectures are rushed and not detailed. Please, UW, find someone else to teach this class.

Very friendly and passionate woman with lots of wisdom to share.  Overall she is a great professor who really knows what she is talking about and is a decent lecturer.  The class is a bit unorganized however and the exams are really hard but there are plenty of other things you are graded on.

Although I just signed up for the bio credits, this ended up being my favorite class. You can tell that Sara loves the subject, and it's infectious. Labs are fun: tree walks, cooking, propagation, etc. Exams cover a lot of content, but you get a notesheet. Lots of extra credit available, so it's not hard to get an A if you put a bit of effort in.

Sara is very passionate. She goes through slides fairly quickly and can be a bit disorganized. This is a service learning class, but hours are easy to rack up. She also gives up to 60 points extra credit. Exams can be a bit tricky, as you feel like you haven't learned much, but are being tested on so much, but she lets you use a sheet of notes.
Powerpoint slides are wordy and she goes through them fast. Exams are tricky and she is a very picky grader. Makes labs very basic, but then expects you to know more for the exams.

Way too much info in slides, makes hard to study for exams. Labs feel like grade school. I hardly learned anything as it is all very basic and still had a hard time getting an A as you need a 94 or above. 20 hours community service and very disorganized. Not worth the effort, take a different class for science credit.

Very knowledgeable and passionate about the subject. Goes through the notes (slideshow) very quickly exams are fair-go to the review sessions, but labs are SO MUCH FUN. Really, she tries so hard to make this course enjoyable. Only thing is service requirement was a little hard to complete: 25 hours in one semester is a lot to fit in.

The labs were a lot of fun.  Attendance at lecture is not mandatory because the powerpoints are put online.  Tests are difficult, but review sheets are handed out well in advance.  If you know the answers on all of the review sheets and go to the review session, you will be fine.  Labs included potato picking, pumpkin carving, cooking with herbs et

Grade is 30% from 2 midterms, 20% from final, and 50% from lab and projects. The 50% from lab and projects are easy and most people got A's. Tests are tricky. Go to the review sessions and know the answers to the review sheet questions. Labs were very fun. We went on tree walks, carved pumpkins, tasted chocolate, and more. It is more work than the average 3 cred. class though.

Sara's pretty out there.  In lecture and lab she makes the class seem extremely easy, but the exams are hard and she isn't a gracious grader.  12 hours of service... not fun.  Requires a lot of time even though it's only 3 credits and most people are just taking it for a science credit.

This class is pretty ridiculous as is the teacher. Its very easy and you dont need to pay attention to lecture as long as you have the handouts. Go to the review sessions and you'll do fine on the tests. You do have to do 12 hours of service which I did not enjoy.
Easy class for a bio credit.  Tests are a bit tough but just go to the review sessions and do the previous year's exam she posts on the website.

Lectures are not the best time ever but she gives handouts and they are word for word. Plus labs are super easy, you take walks and carve pumpkins. If you need a science credit I would take this class. It's not bad at all! Plus she is super helpful if you have any questions.
No Comments

Should keep to her research.  Couldn't answer every question.  Lectures aren't engaging, and the chairs aren't apt for napping.  Exams are ridiculous; tests some things that she doesn't lecture on.  Picks favorites.  If you like the garden, take another class, like propagation or the vegetable garden class.
